trial_identification.studytitle: Physical Therapy in an elderly with diabetic neuropathy: case report
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Physical Therapy in an elderly with diabetic neuropathy: case report

interventions.interventions: The purpose of this case report was to evaluate the effects of a physical therapy intervention in a diabetic neuropathy elderly, through the development of a treatment.The treatment was composed by metabolic exercises, stretching and muscle strengthening, balance training, gait training, classic massage and feet self-care orientation. There were 24 sessions of treatment, (40 minutes each session), twice a week, during 3 months. A trained physiotherapist administered de sessions.
interventions.comparator: There wasn´t a control group. A sensorial, motor, functional assessment and the Foot Health Status Questionnaire (FHSQ-Brasil) were implemented in three phases: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions and after de physical therapy treatment (24 sessions). The results were based in the same participant on different stages.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: tactile sensibility, assessed by Semmes-Weistein monofilaments on 10 feet points.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: pain, by visual analogic scale (0= no pain and 10= the worst pain ever)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: proprioceptive sensibility, by a neuromuscular test. The toe will be posicioned and the patient should answer the direction and the movement of the toe.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: balance, assessed by 3 clinicaltests: tandem position, semi-tandem position and one leg position.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: range of movement, assessed by a goniometer.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

primaryOutcome.outcome: strenght, assessed by kendall descriptions of strengt test. (manual test)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Health status of the foot by a questionnaire (Foot Health Status Questionnaire (FHSQ)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.
3 timepoints: pre-intervention, after 12 sessions of treatment and after intervention.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: elderly, diagosis of diabetes melittus (tipe II), diagnosis of diabetic neuropathy, glicemic control, absence of diabetic ulcers, hability to walk with or without external support, preserved cognition and visual capacity.

fundingsource.fundingname: Fernanda Pretti Chalet Ferreira and Karina Vasconcelos

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Due the fact of the large number of diabetis incidence , the primary purpose of this study is to test a preventive treatment for diabetic ulcers as so the others diabetic neuropathy´s complications.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comissao de etica e Pesquisa do Centro Universitrio Sao Camilo
